page.title: 04WALTHAM ABBEY LIBRARY
page.content: On the 2nd July,1985 a group from class 4R, went to interview the Chief Librarian at Waltham Abbey. The library was built in 1956, and holds approximately{17,000 books. The majority of people who use the library are older people, and youngsters (between six and eight years old). The quietest day of the week is Wednesday. And the busiest period in the year is between October and December. The most popular books are romantic novels for older women. In the past few years tickets have been put onto a{computerised system. About six and a half thousand people belong to the library. In the last five years people use the library less often. But when the{new library is opened in{1986,}it is hoped that more people will make use of the library.
